instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00609: What is 820-00609? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: iMac 2017  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00609</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on
threads.message: I have a 2017 iMac which is not turning on at all. the 4 LED on the motherboard is not turning on at all. I checked it with another power supply but no light or any sign on the logic board. I can see 12.5v or 3.3v on some capacitors so I assume the power supply is fine. Any idea where I should look to?

threads.title: iMac 2017  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00609</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on
threads.message:
No schematic available; you can use 00134 as guide, being similar in some places.
Taking this one as reference, check if you get <SIGNAL>12V_S5_FET</SIGNAL> voltage at <TRANSISTOR>Q8470</TRANSISTOR>.
If not, change <TRANSISTOR>Q8470</TRANSISTOR>.

trying to find <TRANSISTOR>Q8470</TRANSISTOR> with the 00134 boardview ðŸ¤¯
Could you please help me to locate it. Here is a photo of the board. Which area should I look for 

[ATTACH type="full"]60182[/ATTACH]

threads.title: iMac 2017  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00609</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on
threads.message:
There is no other power MOSFET connected with Drain to <SIGNAL>12V_G3H</SIGNAL> (power connector).
You should be able to find it; probably SOP-8, or DFN-8 package.
No sufficient resolution to make an idea in that picture.

Do not quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.
Any reason to do that?
Please, maintain forum aesthetic...
